meanings.definition: A ridge or crest-like structure, especially in biology.
meanings.sent1: The cristae of the mountain stood tall against the sky.
meanings.sent2: The artist sketched the cristae of the leaf in great detail.
meanings.sent3: The cristae of the wave looked like tiny peaks in the ocean.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a way that resembled the cristae of a majestic crown.
meanings.sent5: The cristae of the sand dunes created a beautiful pattern in the desert.

meanings.definition: The infoldings of the inner membrane of a mitochondrion.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the cristae of the mitochondrion were clearly visible.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the cristae to understand the functioning of the mitochondrion.
meanings.sent3: The cristae of the mitochondrion seemed to dance under the lens.
meanings.sent4: The energy production in the cell relied on the cristae of the mitochondrion.
meanings.sent5: The cristae of the mitochondrion resembled tiny folds in a blanket.
